description:
Riding with GPS is becoming increasingly common amongst cyclists, with more riders using the technology to track their rides, plan routes, and combine it with other data to monitor fitness! If you're new to riding, or haven't used a GPS device on the bike before, we have a number of useful tips to help you make the most of it!

description:
This week on the GCN Tech Clinic we're talking about how to check your bike, and what warning signs to look for if you've been in a crash, how to measure wear on your chainrings and cassette, what to upgrade first if you're on a budget, and loads more!

0:00 Intro
0:26 How to fix a bent derailleur hanger?
2:37 How can you measure cassette wear?
3:36 What gears are best for riding on the flat?
4:27 Alloy frame with discs or carbon frame with rim brakes?
5:32 How to brake on a steep descent?
7:35 What should I upgrade first?
8:47 Do you need to grease Thru-axles?
9:18 What‚Äôs the best way to check your bike after a crash?
11:41 Can you get away with a chain that‚Äôs too short?

description:
While it doesn't account for everything, average riding speed is a metric many of us use to quickly judge our rides. Getting fitter is certainly the best way to get faster in general, but there are a few sneaky ways you can increase your average speed without the need for extensive training. Manon and Hank take us through some clever tactics you can use to your advantage.

title: Losing...And Other Life Lessons We've Learned From Cycling | GCN Show Ep. 434

description:
Fixing and maintaining your own bike is really rewarding. Being able to look after your own equipment and keep it running smoothly will make your riding much more enjoyable, and even save you money! However, if you've never worked on a bike before, it may seem quite daunting - but it needn't be! In this new mini series, Alex gives you a crash course in bike maintenance, so you can work on your bike with confidence! If you're keen to get into home mechanics, this is a great place to start!  

Subscribe to GCN+ for cycling as you have never seen it before! LIve racing, shows & cycling adventure films: https://gcn.eu/plus

Subscribe: http://gcntech.co/subscribetogcntech
Pick up your copy of our maintenance book over at The GCN Shop: https://gcn.eu/5F3
#Cycling #GCN #GCNTech #RoadBike

description:
Caffeine is the worlds most popular psychoactive drug, and is enjoyed by many of us in things like tea, coffee, and energy gels. A proven ergogenic aid, caffeine was actually on the WADA banned substances list for a period of time! In this video, Ollie dons his science glasses and explains what caffeine actually is, and how it can enhance your cycling performance.

title: How Does Caffeine Affect Cycling Performance?

description:
When cycling with other bike riders, drafting can save you loads of energy. Sheltering from the wind on another cyclist's wheel can reduce the amount of power you need to produce by up to 50%! In this video, Ollie breaks out the 'GCN Does Science' glasses and takes a deep dive into the physics of drafting, and how it actually works.

Subscribe to GCN+ for cycling as you have never seen it before! Live racing, shows & cycling adventure films: https://gcn.eu/plus

The GCN Shop: https://gcn.eu/5EU
#Cycling #GCN #GCNTech #RoadBike

Do you draft wherever possible? Or do you always do your turn on the front? Let us know in the comments below!

title: The Draft Effect | How Does Slipstreaming Save Energy Whilst Cycling?

description:
The race of truth is the ultimate test of just how fast you are on a bike. Whether it's a dedicated time trial bike, or just your regular road bike, pinning a number on and having a go at a time trial is great fun! In this video, supposed "King of Aero", Ollie, shares a few tips and tricks to make you faster in your next TT!

Subscribe to GCN+ for cycling as you have never seen it before! Live racing, shows & cycling adventure films: https://gcn.eu/plus

Subscribe: http://gcntech.co/subscribetogcntech
The GCN Shop: https://gcntech.co/x4
#Cycling #GCN #GCNTech #RoadBike

Have you ever raced a time trial? Let us know in the comments below!

If you enjoyed this video, make sure to give it a thumbs up and share it with your friends. üëç

description:
We're back with another hill climb battle, where an amateur cyclist takes on a pro! This time, we've changed the rules, Freddie is back but he's got a whole lot of extra wattage at his disposal - will Andrew Feather still be able to hold him off to maintain his climbing dominance?... Watch and find out!

description:

title: Top Tips For Finding Great Cycling Roads In A New Area

description:
There are some bits of cycling tech that are, without question, fast. However, they're not always the most stylish components or bits of kit. This got us thinking: should you prioritise speed or style? On this week's GCN Tech show, Ollie & Alex hear from GCN's resident Fashion expert: Adam Blythe, and the true king of aero: Dan Bigham to see whether speed or style is more important.

Subscribe to GCN+ for cycling as you have never seen it before! Live racing, shows & cycling adventure films: https://gcn.eu/plus

description:
Why don't we use E-Motorbikes when we shoot GCN Videos? What's the ideal depth for an aerodynamic wheel rim? Can you put sealant in an inner tube? All of these questions, and more, answered in this week's GCN Tech Clinic!

description:
One of the best things about cycling is the social aspect of the sport. Riding with a group of like minded cyclists, chatting whilst you ride, and enjoying each other's company at the Cafe stop sets bike riding apart from other sports. But what if you've just moved to a new area, or just got into cycling, and you don't have any friends to ride with? Well, in this video, Hank and Manon share their top tips to help you find people to cycle with!

description:
This week on the GCN Show we discuss why pure power might not be as important as fatigue resistance for winning professional bike races! We've also got chains with diamonds in them, a car trade in scheme that gives you money for a bike and recycling cranks! Join Dan and Si as they discuss all this and more!

title: The Real Secret To Cycling Performance - A Hidden Talent You Might Have? | GCN Show Ep. 433

description:
Local bike shops are an essential part of cycling culture. They're always on hand to help riders in need, and are a gold mine of skills, tools, equipment, knowledge, and experience. It's important to support your local bike shop whenever you can and, in this video, Alex tells you why! Experienced mechanics, bling bikes, top end tools - what's not to love?

title: Support Your Local! | Why You Need To Use Your Local Bike Shop

description:
"How can a road bike cost 10k?!" is a question we get asked a lot, here at GCN. Most bike brand's flagship models currently retail at or above the price of a car! Why is that? In this video, Ollie breaks down just why brands charge so much for some bikes, what goes into justifying this price, and how it compares against other industries. 

Would you spend 10K on a bike? Cast your vote in the GCN App:
https://app.globalcyclingnetwork.com/NWuz

title: How Can A Road Bike Cost ¬£10,000?!

description:
The Tour of Flanders is a huge event and one of the biggest races on the pro cycling calendar. A long parcours and plenty of rough cobbles to contend with means the risk of crashes and mechanical issues is high and, with each team only having 2 cars in the convoy, the task of getting riders back on the road is often left to the neutral support vehicles. We sent Florian from GCN En Fran√ßais to ride along with the Shimano team at this year's RVV to see how their race unfolded!

In association with Shimano: www.shimano.com

description:
This is quite possibly the most iconic vintage bike collection in the world. Alex was lucky enough to get a look at this truly stunning assortment of retro bikes ranging from the 1989 Tour de France winning TVT frame of Greg Lemond to the 1994 Eddy Merckx of Motorola, and everything in between! Sit back, relax, and enjoy a close up look at these beautiful retro racing machines!

title: Hinault, Lemond, Kelly, & More! | Ultimate Vintage Bike Collection

description:
E-Bikes are rapidly increasing in popularity for a variety of reasons, from allowing those who aren't as fast as others to get out on group rides, to replacing the car for a short commute. They get more people into cycling and that's a win in our book! But just how fast can they be? In a previous video Hank managed to beat his dad, George, who was riding an E-Bike but hadn't ridden a bike in 20 years. We decided it was high time for a rematch, but this time George had an ace up his sleeve - he would be riding a de-restricted Canyon Grail On E-Bike to give Hank a proper test and see who would come out on top!
